blog.description:
Amanda, 25, Minnesota, USA. Demiwoman, white, asexual, something-romantic, Romantic, bipolar II (they/them/theirs or she/her/hers). ENFP, Ravenclaw, NG Cleric, Taurus. Museum curator. Loves shipping and Dean Winchester. Reblogs: politics, aro/ace, Supernat, MCU, DW, Yuri on Ice, Merlin, D&D, whatever strikes my fancy, etc.

Take a look at my Resolution19 tag for a collection of 2019 New Years' Resolution drabbles.

summary: The Thing I Really Dread - February 6, 2019
title: The Thing I Really Dread - February 6, 2019
body:
Part of my Resolution19. EDIT: Read it on AO3.

Prompt: “Crowley usually had to fetch Aziraphale to squash particularly large spiders.” (”Mirror, Mirror” ch 4 by ImprobableDreams900 - title from x)

Fandom: Good Omens

Words: 463

It was watching him. Crowley knew it was watching him. He was getting cold as the bathroom fan rattled, drawing cooling moisture off his skin as the shower drip, drip, dripped, but he didn’t dare take his eyes off it.

He quickly contemplated several possible courses of action. He could ignore it and hoped it went away (but it would still be there, just out of sight). He could miracle it away (but that might make it angry). He could…take care of it himself (but it was so fast, his mind wailed at him, what if it got away).

Crowley slowly reached for the nearest towel on the towel rod and patted his hands dry before wrapping the towel around his waist. Then he carefully miracled his mobile phone from the counter into his hand. He unlocked it by muscle memory and was about to glance down to find Aziraphale’s contact info when he paused. There was no telling what might happen if he looked away for even a split second.

He hesitated. Crowley held his phone up closer to his face and held down the “home” button. “Siri, call Angel.”

After several frustrated attempts to get Siri to call “Aziraphale” and not “Zero Phil, what are you doing, Siri, ‘Zero Phil’ isn’t even a thing,” he’d given up and just entered his counterpart in as “Angel.” The good news was that Aziraphale would never find out, even if Crowley handed his phone over, complete with passwords. (Aziraphale was still coming to terms with the ability to send “textual messages” through the phone.)

“Just to confirm,” Siri chirped cheerily, “you’d like to call Angel, mobile.” Leave it to the Americans to invent something so terrible that it annoyed a demon with six millennia of experience dealing with the worst of humanity.

“Call,” Crowley snarled. It was still there, just sitting ever so calmly in the middle of his bathroom floor, as if it owned the place.

“Calling,” Siri informed him serenely.

“'Bout bloody time,” he muttered.

After three, four, c'mon, angel, five, six rings, Aziraphale finally picked up. “Crowley?” Crowley could almost see the puzzled bafflement that would have set in on the angel’s face. “Is everything alright? We’re not set to meet at the Ritz for an hour, right? I’m not late–”

“Aziraphale,” Crowley interrupted. “I need your help.”

“Of course, my dear,” Aziraphale answered promptly. “Whatever is it?”

It was still on his floor, thank Someone. Crowley didn’t know what he’d do if it had moved. “There’s a spider in my bathroom.” There was a moment of silence on the line, and Crowley rushed to fill it. “Would you be able to come over and take care of it?”

Aziraphale’s voice was warm. “Of course, my dear,” he reiterated. “I’ll be right over.”

summary: After rereading and far too much thought, I finally figured out why Aziraphale and Crowley were so important in the final battle...
body:
After rereading and far too much thought, I finally figured out why Aziraphale and Crowley were so important in the final battle in Good Omens! Yes!

…I feel so slow.

tags: i hate this so much but Crowley himseld possessed me briefly so i could bring this abomination into the world
summary: hi my name is Anthony Janthony Crowley Blackfeather, I have shoulder-lenght red dyed hair and jet-black wings (that's how I got...
body: hi my name is Anthony Janthony Crowley Blackfeather, I have shoulder-lenght red dyed hair and jet-black wings (that’s how I got my name), a lot of people tell me I look like David Tennant (a/n if u don’t know who he is get da hell outta here!). I’m not related to Lucifer but I wish I was because he’s a major fucking hottie. I’m a demon and my eyes are bright yellow with slit pupils (that’s because I’m a sssnake). I have pale white skin. I go to a magic place called Hell and I work there (I’m 6000+ years old). I’m a goth, in case you can’t tell, and I wear mostly black. I love hot topic and I buy all my clothes from there. For example today I was wearing a black jacket, black trousers, black crocodile skin shoes with black sunglasses to hide my demonic eyes, and black fishnets underneath (but only Aziraphale knows that), black eyeliner and red eyeshadow. I was walking around Earth. Some angels stared at me. I put my middle finger up at them

blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: Sorry to be another of those Crown of Thorns 'Verse asks that's not exactly a question, but a thought- instead of posting...
question: Sorry to be another of those Crown of Thorns 'Verse asks that's not exactly a question, but a thought- instead of posting #75/finale the day before the miniseries comes out (whenever that is), maybe you should post it a week before (whenever that turns out to be)? That way slow readers like me would have time to digest it before the show crashes in. Your work's too complex/incredible to smash against a distraction of equal magnitude, and I want to enjoy it before I start watching those episodes!
answer:
Before I address any other part of this, anon, thanks so much for your generous expression of how much you’ve enjoyed my work. It’s an honor to know many of you feel that this fic-series finally coming to an end merits as much of your attention as the TV adaptation of the book on which it’s based. I hope this closing chapter (story, really, since that’s what the chapters functionally are) lives up to the hype-like excitement I’m seeing.

Otherwise: your point is beyond valid, and you aren’t the only long-term (or new) reader who has expressed the desire for more leeway in the few days since I finished writing. I could wait until I know what a week before the Amazon release-date is and post it then, or I could do something like…Valentine’s Day posting, March 1st posting, etc. 

 If any of you have strong preferences, please feel free to drop me a line!

summary: Good Omens Quote
title: Good Omens Quote
body:
Currently, what Aziraphale was doing was standing with Crowley by the duck pond in St. James’ Park. They were feeding the ducks.

The ducks in St. James’ Park are so used to being fed bread by secret agents meeting clandestinely that they have developed their own Pavlovian reaction. Put a St. James’ Park duck in a laboratory cage and show it a picture of two men—one usually wearing a coat with a fur collar, the other something somber with a scarf—and it’ll look up expectantly. The Russian cultural Attachés black bread is particularly sought after by the more discerning duck, while the head of M19’s soggy Hovis with Marmite is relished by the connoisseurs.

summary: me on a date: so, anyway, i don’t know what The Arrangement really means. there’s the implication from crowley’s point of view...
body:
me on a date: so, anyway, i don’t know what The Arrangement really means. there’s the implication from crowley’s point of view that, before it developed, aziraphale and crowely were constantly at odds with each other, fighting, killing each other, which is great fodder for fanfic, obviously. but at another point aziraphale internally monologues about how he doesn’t actually know how to get rid of a demon because all he had to do was politely hint at crowley that he was getting tired, and crowley would leave. depending on which interpretation you subscribe to, the time pre-Arrangement has radically different implications for aziraphale and crowley’s relationship and how it had developed by the time of the novel. in addition, regardless, there’s a real disconnect here and the interpretation about this time as reflected on by aziraphale and crowley respectively that says a lot about the characters. personally, i think it shows the different ways in which each of the characters view The Arrangement and so, in a way, what the other means to them. what do you think?

my date: all i did was ask what your favorite book was

tags: IM GETTING THESE DONE I PROMISE
AND IVE BEEN VERY ASLEEP RECENTLY
the actual serpent of eden entering himself into a pet photo contest was funny to me
summary: 22 for the prompt list ~
question: 22 for the prompt list ~
answer:
#22 “Choose me.”

“This is a contest then?” Aziraphale asks, puzzling over Crowley’s iPad. The screen was entirely too busy looking, all these bright colours and ostentatious movements. He does his best to pick out the important, relevant parts, but the adverts are distracting and he hasn’t figured out how to consistently identify them yet. Computers were all well and good, but Aziraphale hasn’t yet made up his mind about this internet business, or this touch-screen business—or even the Apple business—but he did like a few of the puzzle game apps.

“Mm-hmm,” says Crowley, using his index finger to scroll through the website’s image gallery. “It’s a calendar contest. You vote on the picture you most want to see included. It’s all submission based.”

“Sounds simple enough,” says Aziraphale, in the way people do when they don’t want to admit they’re not sure they grasp the concept entirely. He understood voting in contests fine, but wasn’t sure how it worked on this little… device.

“It is,” encourages Crowley, passing Aziraphale the tablet.

Aziraphale holds the thing doubtfully, distrustfully, and copies the way he’d seen Crowley manipulate the screen before. “There’s quite a few…” He trails off and narrows his eyes. “Crowley, this one is you.”

“Could be,” Crowley says passively, looking extremely interested in a knick-knack cluster he knows hasn’t changed, more-or-less, for three decades.

“Hmm, well, I must say there is such a large selection of…” Aziraphale flounders for the proper term. “Amphibians—”

“—Reptiles.”

“—And I couldn’t possibly choose just one to vote for.” Aziraphale punctuates his sentence by holding the iPad back towards Crowley.

“Choose me,” Crowley snaps, shoving the iPad back.

“Oh?” For having had a few millennia to practice, Aziraphale’s innocent expressions were in need of improvement. “I’m sorry, I thought that one wasn’t you.”

“Angel,” Crowley says, tone as fond as it was exasperated. “Has anyone ever told you you’re a bit of a bastard?”

good omens book god, according to my headcanon: [curses crowley to be recognizable as the serpent who damned humanity and that’s why his eyes are like that, he hisses, and his body temperature regulation is bad]

frances mcdormand god, according to my headcanon: lol ok what if we did all that but you also have a bad dye job and a shitty face tattoo forever just because it’s funny
